sections.heading: Consent of parties
sections.text:

sections.heading: Terms on which granted
sections.text:
The court, in so entering or in granting continuances, may impose terms upon the party at whose instance the cause has been continued, by making the party pay costs, or otherwise, as may best further the progress of the cause and the ends of justice.Code 1858, § 2942 (deriv. sections.heading: Judgment for costs
sections.text:
If a continuance is granted on payment of costs, the court shall enter judgment and award execution for the costs.Code 1858, § 2943 (deriv. Acts 1829, ch. 33, § 4); Shan., § 4664; Code 1932, § 8792; T.C.A. (orig. ed.), § 20-1104.

sections.heading: Death of party during continuance
sections.text:

sections.heading: Member of general assembly as attorney, party or witness in case
sections.text:
Upon the motion of a member of the general assembly qualified to make such motion under this section, or the member's attorney or representative, any court, constituted under the laws of this state, any administrative board or commission or other agency authorized to conduct hearings shall grant a continuance or postponement of the proceedings, at any stage of the action, if it is shown that an attorney, party or material witness is a member of the general assembly and that:(1)The general assembly is in annual regular session or special session; or(2)The attorney, party or material witness would be required to be absent from any meeting of a legislative committee while the general assembly is not in session if a continuance is not granted.Acts 1971, ch. 333, § 1; T.C.A., § 20-1106; Acts 1981, ch. 62, § 2.
